name: Can we remove the discrete actuator definitions?
description:
this is more of a "can we structure the new ones efficiently" question
if we can use a single set of actuators with sacrificing the performance that a discrete world provides, then we should do that
we can choose to register a subset of actuators (e.g. no fire/noop when it's not needed), but if "turn left" can be the same either way...

I guess the hardest questions are:
 - how do we deal with the turn/forward velocity?
